Articles.Content: I haven't experienced that, but I haven't really played with MJ since the VAB UI updates. I'll add it to the "list"

it happens with both VOID and Engineer, also with FuseBox throwing NaN for total electrical charge. Note that this doesn't seem to effect anything in the game that I have noticed while actually flying the rocket
Need to add two values to all resource nodes where maxamount = 0, like engines and electric charge. Check a squad engine cfg for details. Otherwise you get NaN errors on right click.
That's not it for the escape tower at least, only resource is SolidFuel and it has amount = 6 and maxAmount = 6

KR-2L from ARM Update makes 3.75m engines absolutely worthless. They weigh more, their Isp is lower, their thrust is lower. This is pretty sad for me, actually - The Liitle Mother was my favourite second stage engine.
Sure hope this mod gets updated soon. I use it a lot. I suspect im not alone.
Yep, my favorite part mods are this one, KW Rocketry and AIES for their really cool cluster fuel tanks.

I haven't figured out why its doing it either.

So far, everything seems to be working with the ARM update. I feel pretty vindicated with respect to a lot of the accusations about my larger tanks and engines being "cheaty" now, as things match up rather nicely with the new stock parts (including the escape towers) - the new 3.75m engines are actually more powerful with better Isp ratings, so NP is actually more difficult.

I'll probably bring the NP engines in line with the new stock ones so they're about as efficient, and they should fill in some usability gaps. The tanks themselves are scaled against one another correctly and should be interchangeable.

Edited April 2, 2014 by Tiberion

I haven't figured out why its doing it either.

So far, everything seems to be working with the ARM update. I feel pretty vindicated with respect to a lot of the accusations about my larger tanks and engines being "cheaty" now, as things match up rather nicely with the new stock parts (including the escape towers) - the new 3.75m engines are actually more powerful with better Isp ratings.

I'll probably make some tweaks to even it out and do some bug fixes, and adjust the tech tree placement a little as well.

I never once felt your parts were "cheaty". They are just bigger, and allow bigger payloads. Its all relative.

And im looking forward to an update Thank you.

Great!

Thanks a lot for an awesome set of rocket parts.

I feel pretty vindicated with respect to a lot of the accusations about my larger tanks and engines being "cheaty" now

Cheaty? Before 0.23.5, NP was a "big engines, big payload, less parts" mod. Of course, that was "cheaty" for some stock-only zealots, but who listens to them? But ARM's KR-2L and KR-25 made NP (and KW, to lesser extent) redundant.

Oh, and BTW, I have a request - 5m engine that falls between Matriarch and Bearcat cluster, around 7500kN thrust. I love my mammoth rockets, but sometimes I like to build something in-between.

Edited April 2, 2014 by biohazard15
If you like huge rockets, take a look at what Yanfret is putting together over at http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64993. Those parts are humongous, and look pretty good too.

I haven't figured out why its doing it either.

So far, everything seems to be working with the ARM update. I feel pretty vindicated with respect to a lot of the accusations about my larger tanks and engines being "cheaty" now, as things match up rather nicely with the new stock parts (including the escape towers) - the new 3.75m engines are actually more powerful with better Isp ratings, so NP is actually more difficult.

I'll probably bring the NP engines in line with the new stock ones so they're about as efficient, and they should fill in some usability gaps. The tanks themselves are scaled against one another correctly and should be interchangeable.

Please don't bring the NP parts in line with the stock parts. The stock 3.75m parts are WAY overpowered.

There is an obvious problem between some of your 3.75 and 5m parts and new rigid joints introduced in 0.23.5.

I've posted this in KJR thread:

If I swap your parts for stock SLS or KW, wobbling stops. According to ferram4, this happens due to incorrect size of attachment nodes.
Having the same issue here even using Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

Is that the NP 3.75m stack decoupler?

Go into: GameData\NovaPunch2\Parts\Decouplers\Decoupler_3_75m_stack

and change the stack nodes in part.cfg to be this:

// --- node definitions ---

// definition format is Position X, Position Y, Position Z, Up X, Up Y, Up Z

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.19, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 3

node_stack_top = 0.0, 0.19, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 3

Let me know if that helps. I'll have to go through and up the node sizes on a lot of the connection parts now.

Is that the NP 3.75m stack decoupler?

Go into: GameData\NovaPunch2\Parts\Decouplers\Decoupler_3_75m_stack

and change the stack nodes in part.cfg to be this:

// --- node definitions ---

// definition format is Position X, Position Y, Position Z, Up X, Up Y, Up Z

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.19, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 3

node_stack_top = 0.0, 0.19, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 3

Let me know if that helps. I'll have to go through and up the node sizes on a lot of the connection parts now.

I'm having issues also with the AA-BB Linear Decoupling Strut and the 5 mt decoupler.

i substitute the lines you suggested in the 5mt but the problem persist

Thanks

Edited April 2, 2014 by edemlama

Alright, got a lot of work done today on some adjustments.

I did have to go through and add node sizes for most of the parts, and that eliminated the joint flex. There's no easy way to just release that, but I really hope to have the last of the changes done tomorrow and release a patch.

Tentative changes:

-Added proper node sizes

-Incorporated the previous hotfix for the VAB icon scaling

-Fixed tank collision on the 'short' and 'medium' tanks at all sizes, no more falling through the ground

-Slightly adjust engine thrust levels for 3.75m engines. Its NOT a balance change, as the Thrust:Mass ratios and staying the same, as is Isp scaling. So the engines won't be 1000 thrust below the new stock engines, but they'll still be tuned to be more realistic or in tune with the other stock parts.

I have not been able to replicate the NaN errors with KER or Mechjeb's readouts in the VAB using 0.23.5 and the latest available updates. I tried using the LES towers and the tanks that have more than one resource like odin's trunk. I also can't make the Odin trunk separate anymore with the new joints.

So if anyone can show me some specific steps to cause the errors, I can investigate further but don't expect a fix for them tomorrow.

Oh, and there were no changes to the joints for surface attachments like radial decouplers as far as I know, so you won't see any changes, more or less wobble than before. For heavy parts like boosters you'll still need a strut from the top of the booster to the main tank to stabilize it.

Oh, and there were no changes to the joints for surface attachments like radial decouplers as far as I know, so you won't see any changes, more or less wobble than before. For heavy parts like boosters you'll still need a strut from the top of the booster to the main tank to stabilize it.

Thanks for the hard work!!

I never had to use strut before for the solid boosters of this specific rocket, so something is definitely not working as suppose (might be KJR, but if that is the case it means the new version utterly sucks)

As you can see from the first picture the boosters are not straight even when off, that never happened before

thanks again can't wait for the final fix

Edited April 3, 2014 by edemlama

I have not been able to replicate the NaN errors with KER or Mechjeb's readouts in the VAB using 0.23.5 and the latest available updates. I tried using the LES towers and the tanks that have more than one resource like odin's trunk. I also can't make the Odin trunk separate anymore with the new joints.

AFAIK, this bug is caused by engines that have alternators (and have ElectricCharge as resource) and doesn't have that resource Tweak feature disabled (there should be isTweakable=false string in part.cfg).

AFAIK, this bug is caused by engines that have alternators (and have ElectricCharge as resource) and doesn't have that resource Tweak feature disabled (there should be isTweakable=false string in part.cfg).

I have this before and i remember if you adjust the electriccharge as well like change it to 1 then back to orginal would temp fix that. i'll try verify this later today.

I have this before and i remember if you adjust the electriccharge as well like change it to 1 then back to orginal would temp fix that. i'll try verify this later today.

Yes, that would fix that.

To fix this bug permanently, you'll need to add these two strings


isTweakable = false
hideFlow = true

to RESOURCE\ElectricCharge portion of part.cfg. This will a) disable EC tweaking in VAB\SPH and hide ElectricCharge generator gauge in right-click menu.

Hmm, I expect that affects almost every engine in the pack then. I'll make those changes tomorrow before I release. Oddly, the Launch towers don't have alternator modules or electric charge, so whatever issue was going in with them (I am not really sure - was it a different error, or an additional error?) must be a different thing.
So... any news on upcoming update?
Packing it up now
